subject.geographic: No. 92 Gravier street, New Orleans, La

mods.abstract: TWENTY-FIVE DOLLARS REWARD. Ran away from the subscriber on Wednesday, 8th inst., the griffe girl MARY, aged about 26 years, about 5 feet in hight, rather deaf, and the effects of an attack of small pox are still visible on her features. She is well known in the upper part of the city, having been owned by the subscriber for about five years. All persons are forbidden from employing or harboring said girl, under penalty of the law. The above reward will be paid oa delivery at the Parish Prison, or to the subscriber at No 92 Gravier street. JOS. C. FERRIDAY. d11 12t*

detail.title: New Orleans daily crescent. ([New Orleans, La.]) 1851-1866

mods.accessCondition: Please submit an LSU Special Collections reference ticket at https://askus.lib.lsu.edu/special for any questions or comments about this digital object.
